definition: Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
variant of 髕|髌[bin4]
Sun Bin's "The Art of War"

sentences.english: Later Sun Bin was framed by Pang Juan and the Prince of Wei had his kneecaps cut out .
sentences.chinese: 後來，孫臏受龐涓陷害，被魏王剜掉了兩個膝蓋骨。

sentences.english: Military Science of Sun Bin marks a milestone in Chinese military history.
sentences.chinese: 《孫臏兵法》在中國軍事發展史上具有里程碑的意義。

sentences.english: Sun Bin word burling, the Warring States period, a famous military strategist.
sentences.chinese: 孫臏字伯靈，戰國時期著名軍事家。

sentences.english: Sun Bin Military tactics is the masterpiece of a famous military strategist, Sun Bin, in the Warring Period.
sentences.chinese: 《孫臏兵法》是戰國時期著名軍事家孫臏的代表作。

sentences.english: Sun Bin Military tactics is the masterpiece of a famous military strategist, Sun Bin, in the Warring Period.
sentences.chinese: 《孫臏兵法》是戰國時期著名軍事家孫臏的代表作。

sentences.english: After that, I know he Jiao Sun Bin .
sentences.chinese: 之後，我知道了他叫孫臏。

sentences.english: Disabled Sun Bin was not discouraged and tricked Pang Juan by pretending to be mad .
sentences.chinese: 孫臏殘疾後，並不氣餒，靠裝瘋騙過了龐涓。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is said that Sun Bin's tactics reached the peak of excellence.
sentences.chinese: 所以說，孫臏的戰術已經達到了盡善盡美的程度。

sentences.english: Sun Bin did much better than Pang Juan and Pang Juan was deeply jealous of him .
sentences.chinese: 孫臏的學業遠遠勝於龐涓，龐涓很嫉妒他。

definition: Pang Juan (-342 BC), military leader and political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)
to be chivalrous

Lü Buwei (?291-235 BC), merchant and politician of the State of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], subsequent Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor, allegedly the father of Ying Zheng 嬴政[Ying2 Zheng4], who subsequently became the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
stratagem
skilled manipulator/tactician/strategist/advisor/counsellor

Di Renjie (607-700), Tang dynasty politician, prime minister under Wu Zetian, subsequently hero of legends/master sleuth Judge Dee, aka Chinese Sherlock Holmes, in novel Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee 狄公案[Di2 gong1 an4] translated by Dutch sinologist R.H. van Gulik 高羅珮|高罗佩[Gao1 Luo2 pei4]
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
military strategy
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
respect for the wise
